name: Lough Erne Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Lough Erne Golf Resort for one night on 20th October, 2007. We were most impressed with this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I together with our 10 and 11 year old were just taking a night off property renovations about an hour away in Donegal. Booked online and stayed in a 2 bedroomed lodge - number 4. We've been fortunate and stayed in some absolutely fantastic five star hotels and upon entering the lodge it was quickly apparent that this was right there up with them. A double room on first floor level with full bathroom and a double room on the ground floor with an identical bathroom. We had a lounge, a dining area and a kitchen-ette. The soft furnishings were oppulent and the lodge was very clean. The binnoculars were a real bonus as we looked out onto the lake and watched the wildlife. The children get their own "cygnets package" where they get to check themselves in and there are tiny bathrobes and slippers on their bed and I mean tiny! The pool, which is all most kids are interested in, is only available to children under 12 between the hours on 10 and 4 so if you're using this as you're touring base then it's a real drawback, however, we had it all to ourselves and had a wonderful 2 hours in the pool, sauna, whirlpool and so on the decor is amazing as is the view out onto the grounds. We did not book for dinner as, again, children under 12 are not welcome after 7pm which is a bit early for us so we had a few drinks on the terrace of the Blaney bar (5 star prices for sure) and walked back to our lodge to cook the kids a pizza in our kitchen-ette unfortunately the over was not connected so it was cheeseboard and crisps all round. Breakfast was stuffy and unclear as to what the format was, we were poured orange juice yet at the cold buffet section all other juices were available. Cooked menu has many choices but the full Irish was poor, bacon and scrambled eggs seriously overdone.
reviews.title: Hotel & Rooms definite 5 star - food more like 3!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really, really lovely family 24 hours and we're returning in August with my parents. My only advise would be "relax" you've got the makings of something very special. we don't need our napkins putting on our knee at breakfast and are you family friendly or are you not - let us into the pool and the restaurant a bit later.
reviews.title: Poor food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I attended a family wedding here and I can honestly say that for five star prices, it was two star food. I am a vegetarian and so were several of the other guests. All the vegetarians had diarrhoea the next day. Probably just a coincidence though!!
reviews.title: A Must Do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The portions are pitiful and the quality of the food was poor. I think they were trying too hard if that makes sense. The staff were all lovely and the hotel and surroundings were lovely. The food let it down.
reviews.title: Just the place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I don't know how they can justify charging up to 50% more for beverages as compared to a normal pub/hotel. I sent a pint of Guinness back 3 times as it was disgusting and half the glass was head. Apparently the lager was the same. Anybody I talked to at the wedding ended up drinking bottled beers and paying extortionate prices for them.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived we were made to feel we were very special. At no time during our 3day stay were we made to feel we were there on a deal.
reviews.title: A Touch of Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was absolutely beautiful & the bed was huge, beautifully comfortable.
reviews.title: OVERALL A FAB HOTEL BUT SEVERAL ISSUES NEED TO BE LOOKED AT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the club house & our meal was lovely. On our last night we dined in the hotel restraunt!! Whaooo!!
reviews.title: Staff are 5-Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our meal was something else, delicious & beautifully presented and the service excellent! Breakfast every morning was of the same high standard, waiting staff could not do enough to please. A special mention for Patsy the Concierge & William at Reception, efficient and again courteous. Nothing was too much trouble to any of the staff. Made our stay one to remember & hope to be back for more of the same.
reviews.title: Fun weekend with a group of friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly I would like to say that this is a great looking hotel in a fabulous scenic location. The hotel has only been open since 2007 so everything is very clean and tidy looking.
reviews.title: Stunning Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights. This was real luxury. The rooms are first rate, we had a lakeview room, very spacious, enormous bathroom with both separate shower and free-standing bath. Nice view over Lough Erne. One evening meal was included and was great, delicious, in fact. The service for the most part was great. The golf course isn't open till later this year but is right next to the existing Castle Hume course. Be prepared to fork out a hell of a lot more money for a stay here when it opens later this year. At the moment, they are offering good rates to get people through the door and generate interest. I couldn't fault the place. It's top quality set amid a spectacular backdrop.
reviews.title: No Complaints

likes.disliked: — Hotel very warm, tend to forget t!o turn corridor music off at nights which keeps you awake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visit beautiful Fermanagh frequently, I love the place. Unfortunately up until now there has been a dearth of good hotels in that area. The Manor House and the Killyhelvin are OK but lack the finer touches. I availed of a two night stay at the Lough Erne Golf Resort this week and was pleasantly surprised. I can only assume that the previous reviewers negative remarks were just teething troubles. The staff were attentive and well trained without being to pushy. I dined in the bar and the main restaurant and thoroughly enjoyed the food. All of those little touches which make a hotel special were in evidence.
reviews.title: Five Star In Fermanagh At Last!

likes.liked: — The log fires and the library.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights.
reviews.title: loved the hotel but a few minor issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival receptionist very welcoming and friendly and explained in detail all the hotel facilities.
reviews.title: Loved Lough Erne Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decor in reception and bar / library welcoming with three fires going very cosy and warm.
reviews.title: wishful thinking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was my first visit and it was superb and I will go back. I had afternoon tea and dinner on both nights. The food is superb and the service was also very good. The icing on the cake was the back and head massage I had in the authentic Thai spa. I have had massage in Thailand and I have to say the Thai therapist was on a par. I booked a full body massage but after talking to the therapist I decided to go for a tailored massage to relieve my back pain and headaches.
reviews.title: Weekend break just great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a relaxing weekend then treat yourself!
reviews.title: Weekend break at Lough Erne Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: This was our first visit to this resort and will return again. From the moment we arrived until our departure the staff were first class, nothing too much trouble, food was superb and surroundings if you enjoy golf or walks in fresh air. It was five star luxury throughout other than slight issue with bed coverings too heavy making sleeping uncomfortable and no air conditioning. Light bedding would fix this issue.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed there for a couple nights at a family get together. The setting of this hotel is breathtaking, nestled beside the beautiful lake it is simply devine. From the moment we checked into one of the wonderful lodges everything about this resort and our stay there was nothing short of perfect. The staff have to be commended for being the perfect balance of professional and welcoming, friendly without being intrusive. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff so charming and pleasant , a blend of hospitality which cannot be learned or taught. A special mention to front office manager Stephen who went that extra mile and made our stay so very memorable and amazing . And also Patsy in guest services who is real gentleman and added to the wonderful stay with his chat and friendliness . We came away refreshed, relaxed and felt as if we had stayed there for much longer than a couple of nights, we cannot recommend this hotel enough, it made our stay in Fermanagh fantastic. We are already planning a return visit.
reviews.title: overnight stay and party
A lovely weekend, lovely staff, a few minor issues.
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at the Lough Erne at my cousin's 60th birthday party.Exceptional service, food,comfort. Will definitely return and highly recommend.A beautiful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009
reviews.text: I had my wedding here in July. We booked the previous Jan and had a lot of concerns and agree with most of the negative comments on here. However, with each visit to the hotel coming up to the wedding we noticed improvements every time and the hotel and staff are still getting better and finding their feet.
reviews.title: Gradually improoving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Huge complaint is no AC in the rooms, this is a big design flaw. Other than that, the hotel and spa is wonderful and the golf is great. In my opinion this is a beautiful hotel and it was a luxury to get married there. If I was to go just for a weekend break, I certainly would not pay their going rates and would only return to stay on a special offer (which they don't do). I don't personally think its worth the prices they charge (when meals and incidentals are all added)
reviews.title: 5Star? - Not Quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here after a wedding. Lovely surroundings and rooms especially the bed which was extremely comfortable. Wheelchair accessible ensuite was one of the best I have come across anywhere, once the toilet seat was screwed on that is! However none of the good stuff will compensate for the loss of a night's sleep. NO AIRCON meant we were uncomfortable and opening the window the restricted amount just let in ....noise!
reviews.title: great views and wonderful golf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: To add to a sleepless night we felt 'robbed' by a distinctly average breakfast which cost £20 each. Did not eat in Restaurant but others reported food and especially drinks to be overpriced. Overall we would go back but in winter when is cooler.
reviews.title: great attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had a trip to Lough Erne with the family and it was a massive place with 2 golf courses close by. The lough Erne course was very tough but gave great views of the lough Erne lakes and the complex, and if you are in to sailing this place is a must. Hotel was very enjoyable but a bit expensive. Small but nice swimming pool for the kids 7,3, & 9. Food was informal in the club house and hotel to fuss for the kids. Next time may try the apartments as I was told the had some. Lively wedding on while there so great to sit out side and people watch
reviews.title: Fabulous Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just returned from this fantastic resort the Staff and Manager should be very proud of the service they provide. Food was fantastic. I was in one of the Lodges overlooking the Lough which was very comfortable.
reviews.title: 5 * Service 6* Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've just returned from a fabulous night at the Lough Erne on a deal purchased through Travel Zoo. As always I'm nervous of these deals as I worry the overall experience will not be a good one. Well, I need not have worried, the room was exceptional as was the evening meal and breakfast. Even better than the Ritz Carlton Powerscourt which I thought couldn't be beaten. We're returning in August for a wedding and the hotel have kindly guaranteed the same room for our return visit.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Very relaxing and peaceful stay at Lough Erne. Friendly and efficent staff who were attentive and helpful.
reviews.title: Romantic escape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful food in the restaurent , the highlight of the stay!
reviews.title: 5 star staff and hotel, 1 star food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Needs some feminine touches. Would have like to have seen a cocktail menu in the bar and some magazines other than golf mags in the spa.
reviews.title: Lough Erne Resort Faldo Golf Clubhouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Lough Erne Golf Resort for the 3rd time in 4 years. I’m the opposite to a below contributor in that I really enjoyed our meal and breakfast, but was (once again) disappointed by the rooms and pool area. Probably a matter of taste, but red bedding, yellow walls and mahogany furniture scream 1990 to me. Our “king size” bed was two twin beds pushed together – Ok for couples who keep to their own side of the bed I guess. The bathroom is very nice, but all in all, nothing about the rooms scream 5* to me except for the price. Public areas are very nice and the grounds are spectacular. Pool is small, just knowing this hotel is only 5 years old I can’t understand how the layout could not have been improved. As mentioned, we thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast, dinner and wine and the ambience of the public area is lovely.
reviews.title: Very very good, element of luxury - but missing a few things.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me, Lough Erne falls 3rd to Solis Lough Eske Castle and the Slieve Donard on design and luxury feel. I sound very picky in saying this as it is a stunning hotel, but there are better out there and its just disappointing as it had so much potential.
reviews.title: Fabulous place to stay, idyllic location, lovely rooms, attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I ever do go back I would try a lodge (at least we might have a chance of a doublebed)
reviews.title: An unforgettable experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights around a friend's wedding at this hotel. Our room was fabulous, spacious and plush decor. My only niggle was the wobbly toilet seat! The concierge staff were hugely attentive, even giving us lifts around the resort to other friends accommodation, as were waiting staff at breakfast. Stunnning views across the Lough. Great choice at breakfast and three different dining options and menus available for dinner from the formal dining room to the hotel bar or clubhouse at the golf club. I don't play, but my friend says it is the best golf course he has played on too. Would highly recommend as a treat.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I took a one night break to the Lough Erne Golf resort last weekend. I cannot rave about our stay enough and have recommended it to so many people since coming home.
reviews.title: Fur Coat...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband and I and another couple had a lovey break in this hotel. The hotel is lovely with great views of the lake where you can go for a nice stroll around the hotel. They have 2 golf courses and a very nice thai spa. The only comlpaint I had about our 2 night break was the service, it was the only thing that let the place down but I would still go back again!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, very enjoyable spa treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights at this resort in a Lakeview room. The Buildings are superb, well furnished and comfortable. The Golf Course, (which I walked as it was not due to open until July) is magnificent and I will return to play it soon, beautifully laid out some very tricky holes, but it looks a joy.
reviews.title: Magnificent Golf Course,Buildings excellent, Staff need a lot of proper training to reach 5* level.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In general the younger staff were friendly and efficient, but I must take real issue with some of the more senior staff ( No name badges so I don`t know who they were), who appeared to have forgotten how to smile and also appeared to take any query of food or service as a personal slur.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but not 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These included.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel... but can't help feeling ripped off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009
reviews.text: No air conditioning in the rooms.
reviews.title: Out of this World!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Definately built to a 5 star standard - even if outside needs to be finished off. Room was fine but felt a little cramped, bathroom excellent. Dinner was very good but as others have pointed out they need to do something about the breakfast. Overall feeling is that it missing something to make you feel you had five star experience.
reviews.title: Missing something

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Truly an astounding and wonderful location to visit. I recently attended a three day UK conference and I have to say we truly got five star treatment throughout our stay. As soon as you walk through the door you were met with a warm smile and given a very pleasant welcome. The food and service was of the highest standard and all the staff were very attentive to our needs. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. In particular, Trisha and Mike made the experience a real pleasure. I would definitely come back for another conference and would recommend anyone to use it as a venue - you wont be disappointed.
reviews.title: One of my best experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had never even heard of the Lough Erfne Golf Resort before we went here. We stayed in the lodges beside the hotel overlooking the lough. Everything about the hotel and our stay was perfect. Breakfast was fabulous, staff were so so friendly and accomodation was fantastic. I couldn't believe how reasonable it was for 5 star luxury. The golf course is supposed to be spectacular although I don't play so can't confirm that! I would recommend to anyone for a nice long relaxing break away and can't wait to go back....
reviews.title: The most beautiful hotel in Ireland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here on Tuesday night 3rd March as I was on business in Northern Ireland. I generally find I can get a room at a nice hotel for a good price midweek (e.g. Radisson Limavady, Clandeboye Lodge), and I managed to get the Lough Erne for £80 B&B. I believe they do offers from time to time. I need to stay at a hotel which offers wireless internet so I can do my e-mails at night, rather than a B&B.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning-but crazy food prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a long approach to the hotel which dissects the golf course (looks very nice), and goes past new-build lakeside cottages and houses (which look top end but are a bit close together).
reviews.title: Great spot for a short break.

description: Lough Erne Resort, Enniskillen, Co. Fermanagh, host venue to the G 8 Summit 2013 is the first AA and NITB Five Star Hotel in Northern Ireland and was awarded 'Best Hotel' at the 2011 Northern Ireland Tourism Awards. In 2010, it was awarded ‘Golf Resort of The Year’ by the Irish Golf Tour Operators Association. The Resort is the ultimate expression in old world heritage and new world luxury, set on its very own 600 acre peninsula, between Castle Hume Lough and Lower Lough Erne, just outside Enniskillen, with stunning panoramic views from almost every vantage point. This unique luxury Fermanagh hotel’s facilities include: •120 luxury Rooms and Suites•Two Championship Golf Courses including The Faldo Course, a Golf World & Golf Monthly Top 20 Course (UK & Ireland) and the Championship Castle Hume Course•Rory McIlroy has been its Touring Professional representing The Resort around the World•The Golf Academy, a state of the art Practice and Tuition centre•Authentic Thai Spa, with Thai Therapists using Thai Products and techniques•A variety of innovative Dining Experiences with menus composed by Award winning Chef, Noel McMeel. Including: The Catalina Restaurant, The Blaney Bar with an Exclusive collection of 101 Irish Whiskies; The Loughside Bar & Grill, a variety of Afternoon Teas in The Garden Hall and The Halfway House located behind the 9th Green of The Faldo Championship Course•6 Conference & Meeting Rooms•Cygnets The 'BIG' Experience for our younger guests (0-11 years)•One of Ireland’s most romantic Wedding Venues. All this combined with warm, friendly and attentive service make Lough Erne Resort one of the world’s most magical destinations.
